title: Damasqueiro (Prunus Armeniaca)
body:
Tree originating from China, widely cultivated in Madeira.

Its fruits, which appear in June and July, vary greatly in terms of size and even color, with a variety of apricots called black, whose epicarp has the color of certain plums.

The main varieties of apricots that appear in Madeira are as follows: genuine apricots, French, white, churros, alperches, “pêches“ and maracotões.

Madeira: Place of origin of the tree, widely cultivated
